Posts.Content: Shirley, No one can make the decision for you. It's up to you to decide what you think is best. If it were me, I'd opt to wait (Dr. b suggestion) and do another mammogram in 3 months. Sometimes Drs. are too anxious to cut and mess with things and make it worse, but ultimately it's up to you. Decide your risk factors, anyone in the family have breast cancer, age giving birth, start of period, taking birth control, etc. and do what you feel the most comfortable with. God bless.
Posts.Title: Do I need to do a surgical biopsy or see another doctor?

Posts.Content: My husband took Neulasta shots and he got bone pain afterwards. Everyone reacts differently, though. Be sure to let her Dr. know of the effects. Her oncologist should be notified of any reactions or changes immediately. Good luck and keep us informed.
Posts.Title: Question about Neulasta

Posts.Content: Stop worrying! You've had every test and everything is normal . Pain and tenderness are normal with hormone fluctuations and too much caffeine. Cut back on the caffeine and stop stressing.
Posts.Title: Unexplained Breast Pains

Posts.Content: If it's just a booster I would wait a while and give your body a chance to recover and rebuild your immunity. Don't overstress your body while it's trying to heal. They suggest every 10 years but it's not written in stone. If you receive a serious injury they will give you a tetanus shot anyway so I wouldn't bother with it. Take care
Posts.Title: Radiation and tetanus shot?

Posts.Content: Why does your doctor want you to have a tetanus shot?
Posts.Title: Radiation and tetanus shot?
